headline: Markets mixed, chip stocks fall, meme stocks: Market Takeaways
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) ended Friday's session mixed. Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre outlines some takeaways of the trading day, including equity market weakness, chip stock moves, and the rise of meme stocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: What Are the 5 Best Bargain Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy Right Now?
summary: AMD, Broadcom, and Nvidia are all cheap chip stocks given their projected growth.  Salesforce and Adobe are two SaaS companies riding the AI wave that have fallen into the bargain bin.  One of the best ways to find bargains in a hot sector is to look beyond stocks' price-to-earnings (P/E) ratios and instead look at their price/earnings-to-growth (PEG) ratios, as this metric takes into consideration their earnings growth.

headline: Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock: Nvidia vs. Broadcom
summary: Broadcom stock has delivered stronger returns than Nvidia in the past year.  Despite its larger revenue base, Nvidia continues to grow faster than Broadcom.  A look at valuations helps clarify which AI stock is the better one right now.

headline: This AI Trader Bought Meta Stock and Dumped Eli Lilly
summary: When you’re stumped or don’t have the time or simply don’t want to make the decision, leave it to an AI stockpicker.  The stockpicker has three U.S.-listed exchange-traded funds—they have a combined asset value of roughly $50 million—that it rebalances every month.  Qraft’s momentum fund,  allocates holdings that have performed well in the past based on the assumption that they will keep climbing.

headline: Synopsys Establishes PCIe 6.x Compatibility with Broadcom (AVGO) Switch
summary: Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ:AVGO) is one of the best stocks to buy. On June 11, software giant Synopsys, Inc. (NASDAQ:SNPS) reported seamless compatibility between its PCIe 6.x IP and Broadcom’s PEX90000 series switch. The demonstration, operating at 64 GT/s, showcases compatibility between the two companies’ PCIe 6.x technologies, which are designed for high-performance computing and AI […]

headline: 3 Market-Beating Stocks with Solid Fundamentals
summary: Stocks that outperform the market usually share key traits such as rising sales, expanding margins, and increasing returns on capital. The select few that can do all three for many years are often the ones that make you life-changing money.

raw.headline: 3 Market-Beating Stocks with Solid Fundamentals
